item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "War is what happens when language fails." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "We must always take sides. Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim. Silence encourages the tormentor, never the tormented." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "Wherever men and women are persecuted because of their race, religion, or political views, that place must — at that moment — become the center of the universe." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Elie Wiesel
Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You will always be fond of me. I represent to you all the sins you never had the courage to commit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Paradoxically though it may seem, it is none the less true that life imitates art far more than art imitates life." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Who, being loved, is poor?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "America is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Experience is merely the name men gave to their mistakes." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "No good deed goes unpunished." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Gabrielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live." -- Oscar Wilde
